basic_information.scholarship_name: Freda J. Cross Scholarship for the Arts-NOMINATION
basic_information.scholarship_notes: Cycles through the departments in the following order: Theatre, ACM, SOM, SOD, Dance, Art 2021/2022 - Design

description: This scholarship was established in 2012 by CFAD dean's staff member Anthony Tompkins and his wife, Kari, in memory of Anthony's mother, the late Freda J. Cross. Freda Cross was a Central alumna and successful lawyer who enjoyed fashion, style, gardening and the arts, in addition to spending time with family and friends. After Freda's life was tragically ended in 2011, Anthony and Kari considerately established a memorial scholarship for CFAD students. Demonstrative of Anthony's love for UCO and respect for all areas of our college, this scholarship benefits a student of a different division each year in the following order: Department of Theatre Arts, ACM@UCO, School of Music, School of Design, Department of Dance, Department of Art. Eligibility Major in the College of Fine Arts and Design Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 This scholarship will go to a Department of Dance student in 2024-25 scholarship cycle. Requirements AWARDED BY COMMITTEE NOMINATION. Nominated student(s) will be invited to apply by the college's scholarship coordinator.

general_criteria.description: Soft requirements that provide additional points/consideration

hard_criteria.description: Hard requirements that must be met to qualify for the scholarship

criteria.description: Complete Application: "UCO Foundation Qualifying Scholarship Application"
